result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather R Wandersee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatments
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to submit to random urinalyses as determined by the Agent, but to occur at least one time per month
--to obtain/maintain gainful employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--no contact with Jeremy Sharp or Cynthia Rogalski
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as allowed by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment or education program, as authorized by the Agent
--not to be present at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession of illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia
--to take all prescriptions as prescribed, and with the knowledge and the permission of the Agent

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

The Court expresses its intent to the parties that, if it is learned that the consecutive-nature of the Probation term in Case #14CF125 results in the Probation term commencing in Case #14CF 125 upon release to Extended Supervision in case #13CF467 (and not at the conclusion of the ES period in Case #13CF467), then the Court intends to re-sentence Ms. Wandersee in Case #13CF467 to a term of 5 1/2 years with 2 years Initial Confinement and 3 1/2 years Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes:
On Case #14CF125-Count #1 the Court sentences Ms. Wandersee to serve 6 months in Jail without any Huber privileges.

The Court orders DNA sample provision

The Court orders payment of any unpaid court costs and fees.  The Court grants Ms. Wandersee sixty days to pay the amount due in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  (All costs have been paid in this case)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather R Wandersee

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry

[MK] cases #18CF423 and #14CF125 called at 11:28am 
Defendant Heather R Wandersee in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
_________________ 
Plea hearing is held in Case #18CF423: 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " is entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Wandersee guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remaining counts [Counts #2, #3.]
__________________

On Case #14CF125-Count #1 the Court sentences Ms. Wandersee to serve 6 months in Jail without any Huber privileges.
Days credit for time served:  127 days 
The Court orders DNA sample provision
The Court orders payment of any unpaid court costs and fees.  The Court grants Ms. Wandersee sixty days to pay the amount due in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive. 
__________________


On Case #18CF423-Count #1 the Court sentences Ms. Wandersee to serve 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  years &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  [inserted clerk's note:  post hearing  the Court indicates to the clerk that this sentence is consecutive to any other sentence.  The Court's Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence form confirms that the sentence is consecutive to any other.] 
The Court finds that Ms. Wandersee is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Ms. Wandersee is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.
The Court STAYS this sentence and places Ms. Wandersee on Probation for three years with conditions:  
--Immediately upon release from Jail Ms. Wandersee must check into Rogers Memorial Hospital Adult Mental Health for purposes of rehabilitation.  Ms. Wandersee must attend the entirety of the Inpatient Program. Ms. Wandersee may not leave the Program early on her own volition. Ms. Wandersee is to complete the Program.  If there is any failure in that Program's terms and conditions, the result is that the Stay on the Imposed Sentence is lifted  and the Imposed Sentence will be served. 
--to follow through with any recommended treatment and relapse prevention that Rogers Memorial Hospital may have 
--to undergo an independent and separate assessment, treatment and follow through  
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment and follow through that may be required
--to obtain/maintain full time or part time employment and /or education programming as approved by the Agent
--not to possess or consume any alcohol
--not to possess or ingest any controlled substances without a prescription 
--only to take prescription medicine as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to be subject to random drug and alcohol testing 
--not to affiliate, other than in a thereuptic setting, with any known drug offenders 
--to pay costs, fees and surcharges through the Department of Corrections [inserted clerk's note:  this condition of Probation was added post hearing/off-record by the Court after the clerk inquired about payment of court costs]

Felony firearm warnings are given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:58am.
Character Letters
Adjustment Number: 19A 059324, Payable Number: 160449, Receipt Number: 19R 005727, Amount: $20.00
Attorney Fischer
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 21, 2019 at 11:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 2, 2019 at 11:00 am.
w/ revocation summary

records.addlTxt:
[Clerk: MK]
cases #13CF467,#14CF125,#14CF166 called at 3:06pm. 
Defendant Heather R Wandersee in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

In response to the Court's inquiry regarding the status of case #14CF166, Attorney Luchsinger indicates that there has not been any resolution of the case.
The Court redirects Case #14CF166 to Branch IV for scheduling.
Counsel acknowledge receipt of the PSI. Factual corrections to the PSI are made by counsel, and noted on the PSI Report in the Court's own hand. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Wava Wandersee makes a statement in support of her daughter. 
Heather Wandersee gives a statement.

In Case #13CF467-Count #3, the Court sentences Ms. Wandersee to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.

The Court finds that Ms. Wandersee is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Ms. Wandersee is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  27 days credit for time already served [subject dates are 11/22/13 to 12/19/13].

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatments
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--
to submit to random urinalyses as determined by the Agent, but to occur at least one time per month
--to obtain/maintain gainful employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--no contact with Jeremy Sharp or Cynthia Rogalski
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as allowed by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment or education program as authorized by the Agent
--not to be present at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession of illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia
--to take all prescriptions as prescribed, and with the knowledge and the permission of the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay a drug testing fee of $375
--to reimburse $300 in buy money 
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

---------------------------------------------------------

In Case #14CF125-Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Wandersee on Probation for 18 months, consecutive to Case #13CF467, with conditions:   
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatments
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to submit to random urinalyses as determined by the Agent, but to occur at least one time per month
--to obtain/maintain gainful employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--no contact with Jeremy Sharp or Cynthia Rogalski
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as allowed by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment or education program, as authorized by the Agent
--not to be present at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession of illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia
--to take all prescriptions as prescribed, and with the knowledge and the permission of the Agent
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 




Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
The Court expresses its intent to the parties that, if it is learned that the consecutive-nature of the Probation term in Case #14CF125 results in the Probation term commencing in Case #14CF 125 upon release to Extended Supervision in case #13CF467 (and not at the conclusion of the ES period in Case #13CF467), then the Court intends to re-sentence Ms. Wandersee in Case #13CF467 to a term of 5 1/2 years with 2 years Initial Confinement and 3 1/2 years Extended Supervision.
recess 4:00pm.
[Post-hearing/Off-record note:  the Court realizes that it failed to address the Bond Forfeiture issue at the hearing.  The Court indicates to the clerk that the $1000 cash bond and the $150 cash bond that are currently in forfeiture status are to be applied toward payment of the court financial obligations in both case #13CF467 and #13CF125.]
Pre-trial conference on June 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Affidavit from Deputy regarding administration of bond to defendant
Bond was posted and administered to surety at Clerk of Courts Office, Bond was administered to Defendant by JCSD (Original bond was returned to CO by JCSD on 5/23/14)
Bond to cover 13CF467, 14CF125 & 14CF166

cases #13CF467 & #14CF125 called at 9:33am.
Defendant Heather R Wandersee in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court hears arguments on the State's Motion to Modify Bond. 
The Court grants the State's Motion to Modify Bond.
The Court finds the $1,000 cash bond posted in case #13CF467 and the $150 cash bond posted in case #14CF125 to be in default.

INITIAL APPEARANCE HELD IN CASE #14CF166:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 cash bond that applies to all three cases #13CF467, #14CF125, #14CF166 (this amount is separate from the $1,000 cash bond and $125 cash bond that were previously posted), with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 
-No direct or indirect contact with Jeremy Sharp or Benjamin Bates or Holly Uphoff.
recess 9:42am.

NEXT:  (1) schedule a Bail Forfeiture Hearing in case #13CF467on the $1,000 cash bond amount previously posted and in case #14CF12)  (2) Pretrial Conference on 6/4/14 at 1:00pm. (3) the 6/24/14 Sentencing Hearing remains on the Court's calendar in cases #13CF467 and #14CF125 (4) schedule case #14CF166 for Status Conference on the same date and time-- JA please note in comments that this case is at Prelim stage and is assigned to Branch IV along with the Co-Defendant
States motion for bond modifications//Acknowledgment of review by the court
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
3 citizen letters submitted to the Court by the Defense prior to the hearing.
with criminal case settlement agreement and elements form attached.

Cases 13CF467, 13CF275 and 14CF125 called at 2:45pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Heather R Wandersee in court with attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  ADA Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel inform the Court that agreement has been reached in these matters and the request of the parties is to proceed through Plea Hearings today with sentencing occurring at a later date.  Defense will move for a PSI.  State opposes an order for PSI.  The State's bond modification motion will also be addressed today.
14CF125 only:
Service admitted; reading waived.
Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form submitted.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding and intent.  Court accepts the waiver.
Court finds probable cause that the Def. committed a felony and binds the Def. over for arraignment and trial.
Information filed by the State.  Charges reviewed by the Court. 

All cases:
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
Case 13CF467 - Count #3 - Guilty  plea entered by the Defendant.
Case 14CF125 - Count #1 - Guilty  plea entered by the Defendant.
Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea in each case.  Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered in each case.

State moves to read-in and dismiss 13CF275, 13CF467 - Count #1 and #2 and 14CF125 - Count #2 and Count #3; so ordered by the Court. 

Arguments regarding an order for PSI and bond modification presented by Counsel.  Court orders a PSI (long form) with Sentencing to be scheduled in approx. 75 days; presents basis. 
Court denies the State's motion to modify bond; presents basis.  Court confirms that the surety does not wish to withdraw the funds posted.  Court continues the $1000 cash bond already posted. 
Recess 3pm
Copy of Criminal Complaint
